intro: Saurauia herthae var. oligantha, commonly known as the Herth's saurauia, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to the high-altitude regions of Southeast Asia, particularly in countries like Thailand and Vietnam. The plant is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
